snippet: The police said a car carrying five teenagers careered off the Southern State Parkway on Monday morning, killing four of the passengers after the vehicle hit a stand of trees.
abstract: Car carrying five teenagers from Queens careers off the Southern State Parkway on Long Island, killing four of the teens after hitting a stand of trees; only survivor is the driver, Joseph Beer, who was driving with only a learner's permit, and apparently lost control of the vehicle after failing to navigate a notorious bend in the parkway.

byline.original: By J. DAVID GOODMAN and RANDY LEONARD
byline.contributor: Al Baker and Lisa Schwartz contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The police said a car carrying five teenagers careered off the Southern State Parkway on Monday morning, killing four of the passengers after the vehicle hit a stand of trees.

headline.seo: Crash on Southern State Parkway Kills 4
headline.main: 4 Die in Crash at Notorious Turn on L.I. Road
headline.print_headline: 4 Die in Crash at Notorious Turn on L.I. Road
